isis.stitle: TSI 05-12-10 - Valve Cover Electrical Connector Lock

warning.para: To avoid serious personal injury, possible death, or damage to the engine or vehicle, make sure the transmission is in neutral, parking brake is set, and wheels are blocked before doing diagnostic or service procedures on engine or vehicle. Read all safety instructions in the "Safety Information" section of the service manual for this engine.

caution.para: To avoid engine damage, turn the ignition switch to OFF before unplugging a connector or relay. Failure to turn the switch to OFF will cause a voltage spike and damage to electrical components.

figure.caption: Figure 1. Valve cover electrical connector lock
Figure 2. Lock shown flush with electrical connector, indicating it is fully seated

geninfo.para:
The valve cover electrical connector lock
ensures that each fuel injector and Injector Control Pressure (ICP) electrical connector is fully seated
during assembly at the engine plant.

Each of the six fuel injectors and ICP electrical connectors have connector locks installed during production build at the factory. The Brake Control Pressure (BCP) sensor connector and the engine brake shut-off valve connector do not have the connector locks installed during production.
These locks are not available as service parts since they are only used as a production aid and not intended as a service installation part.
If a connector with a lock needs servicing, remove the lock before attempting to disconnect the connector.

figure.caption: Figure 3. Arrows indicate where to grab lock with needle nose pliers
Figure 4. Remove lock with needle nose pliers

item.para: Insert tip of the needle nose pliers in the U-shaped section of the lock while positioning the other tip of the pliers between the lock top and the connector .
With the pliers gripping the lock, pull the pliers away from the valve cover to remove the lock .
After removing the lock, the electrical connector can be removed from the valve cover gasket, after pressing the release tab for the connector.
Ensure the electrical connector is fully seated and latched when reinstalling it. An improperly installed electrical connector can cause a no-start condition or damage to a component.

caution.para: Connectors must be properly seated and latched to avoid possible driveability concerns or a no-start condition. Installing connectors on an angle may cause an improper connection and damaged components. Apply light pressure to get the connector into position and then fully seat the connector.

note.para: The lock does not need to be re-installed after proper installation of the electrical connector has been completed.
